ygData.subject: Re: Help in dueling
ygData.msgSnippet: At level 34 I beat up a level 41 warrior.  It s just a matter of avoidance. Shadowstep, darkness, shadowstep, dot, shadowstep, dot.  It s tough against the
ygData.messageBody:
At level 34 I beat up a level 41 warrior. It's just a matter of avoidance.
Shadowstep, darkness, shadowstep, dot, shadowstep, dot. It's tough against
the higher level warriors, just because those bastards have so many
hitpoints :) I'd usually get all my DOT's set, shadowstep once more then
gather shadows and med ;) it's a mean and nasty strategy and they'll bitch
to no end about you not fighting fair...but hey...if you can't use your
spells, they can't use their weapons and armor ;)

----- Original Message -----
From: Trizzen Do'Trevan <trizzen@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, October 20, 1999 10:05 AM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Help in dueling


> From: Trizzen Do'Trevan <trizzen@...>
>
> Last night, I watched a level 26 necromancer with a
> pet, get wiped off of the face of Norrath by a 24th
> level ogre warrior. I have some strategies for necro
> against caster, but how do you fight a warrior? The
> necro could not get any of his spells of as the
> warrior bashed/kicked/slashed him to death. The fight
> took a while as the necro ran around without much
> effect. End result, one dead necro, ogre at half
> health. They only thing I could think of was sic pet,
> shadow step, cast darkness, then proceed.
>
> I guess I have two questions:
>
> What strategy do you all use for necro vs warrior
> type?
>
> What strategy do you all use for necro vs caster type?
>
> I am really curious to see what everyone says to this.
>
> Thanks!
>
> Darkmoon Somberlight
> 24th level necromancer Quellious
>
>
> =====
>
> > This list is basically unmoderated. However abusive language will not be
tolerated
>
